text: May unemployment rates ranged from 2.5% in New Hampshire to 8.1% in Hawaii.
Twenty-two states saw three-decade peaks in annual house price growth in Q1 2021.
Only IA, SD, UT, and WA saw an increase in GDP from Q4 2019 to Q4 2020.
Leisure jobs are up in all states over the year but below pre-pandemic levels in most states.
Among states, average private weekly earnings in May ranged from $784 in MS to $1,279 in CA.
From Q1 2020 to Q1 2021, house price increases ranged from 4.7% in HI to 23.7% in ID.
State and local public education jobs declined between May 2020 and May 2021 in 14 states.
Nevada’s unemployment rate was 7.8% in May 2021, down from 24.5% in May 2020.
NY’s accommodation and food services GDP fell 46% between Q4 2019 and Q4 2020.
Retail employment in May 2021 exceeded January 2020 levels in only eight states.
Manufacturing GDP increased in 44 states and DC between Q3 2020 and Q4 2020.
